TO: Officers and Directors of HAEB DATE: 12 August 1952
FROM: Burton Paulu
SUBJECT: ilemorandum of August 7 from John W# Dunn, Chairman Membership
Committee, Relative to Applications from Flint and Battleereek,
Michigan
Of course I m ready and willing to vote into Active Membership the
Board of Education of the City 0f flint and to Associate Membership the
Battlocreek Public Schools,
However I would like to raise a question of form. In his memorandum
John says^ "If no protests are received in the office of the Executive
Director of NAEB by August 20th, 1952, the applications ss noted below
will be considered passed by the Board of Directors and the applicants
will be so notified by the Executive Director,"
This may be a somewhat pic punish point to raise-, but Article I5
Section (/) of our constitution nays: "Any university, college, school,
or other educational or public service agency of recognised standing
engaged in educational, noncommercial broadcasting over a radio station
controlled by it, or holding a construction permit for such a station,
may be elected to membership by the Board of Directors,"
I wonder if the underlined phrase dcesn* t require positive action
rather “than the absence of a veto? That is, doesn't this require a majority
of a quorum of the Board to*"vote”'affirmatively on an application to member¬
ship rather than merely the absence of any protests?
Perhaps Brother Frank Schocley, our constitutional interpretor. can
give us some guidance here.
